properties.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 12 at 2:53AM PST until January 12 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Tidal overflow flooding expected. Sneaker waves
possible.

* WHERE...South Washington Coast.

* WHEN...Tidal Overflow Flooding is expected from noon today to 4
PM PST this afternoon. Sneaker waves are possible from 7 AM PST
this morning through 4 PM this afternoon.

* TIDAL OVERFLOW IMPACTS...Minor flooding, up to one foot above
ground level, during the 2 PM high tides in the low lying areas
near bays, sloughs, and the lower reaches of the coastal rivers.
Similar conditions in the past have resulted in minor flooding
on HWY 101 in Raymond and South Bend.

* SNEAKER WAVE IMPACTS...Sneaker waves can suddenly knock people
off of their feet and quickly pull them into the frigid ocean
which may lead to serious injury or drowning. Sneaker waves can
lift or roll large water soaked logs which can lead to serious
injury or death.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Total tide of 11.25 feet (10.5 feet with a
0.70 anomaly) around 2 PM.
properties.instruction:
A Coastal Flood Advisory means that tidal overflow flooding is
expected. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert
for rising water, and take appropriate action to protect life and
property.

A Beach Hazards Statement is issued when sneaker waves create
potentially life-threatening conditions in the surf zone. Caution
should be used when in or near the water.  Always keep an eye on
the waves, and be especially watchful of children.

NWSheadline: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM PST THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY FOR TIDAL OVERFLOW IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON
